answers.answer: Obviously he needs to revisit his doc about his legs, since there's a chance his sugars are not being controlled well enough and could be affecting the circulation in his legs and making them hurt worse than ordinary sciatica.  But if it's indeed pain from his spine problems, then again he needs to visit his doc, and he can prescribe pain meds for it, which they are loathe to prescribe opiates, so he could tell his doc he's heard about gaba drugs that help with pain.  I take pregabalin (Lyrica), and its cheaper cousin is gabapentin (Neurontin), and they are anti-spasm type drugs, and I found relief from my lower back pain overnight and continue to take it for several years now.  Aside from medicine, one good way to relieve sciatica is to do yoga type stretching exercises, but since he has spine problems, it's best for him to ask his doc if maybe some physical therapy could be ordered for him to ease the pain.  I tried yoga for a while and had to quit because my spine is wrecked up and I managed to hurt it temporarily whilst doing those.  Drinking extra water is good for the kidneys, by the way, and helps a person feel better in general.

Hi, Thank you for your question. Sciatica is a set of symptoms including pain that may be due to compression or irritation of the sciatic nerve, which may occur due to disc hernia, disc degeneration or spondylolithesis. So, the treatment modalities also range from anti-inflammatory, physiotherapy, non-surgical decompression or surgical decompression. But, surgical modalities may have 50% chances of relapse of pain. Before opting for surgical procedures, you should evaluate both the pros and cons. Hope this helps.

question: With kidney problems, fatty liver, diabetes, and bipolar disease, what can my brother-in-law take for severe nerve pain in his legs?  His PCP believes it's sciatica from his spine problems, although I'm sure the diabetes is also a likely culprit.  Is there any medication he can take for the severe pain he's in?
title: Sister's husband with chronic sciatic pain and bad kidneys
